commands.status.title: =====Mc2Discord=====
config.lang.comment:
Set language for this configuration file. Delete the rest of the file to update. Thanks to the translators: %s
 Supported languages: %s
config.general.comment:
Mc2Discord configuration file
  - Curseforge (Download): https://www.curseforge.com/minecraft/mc-mods/mc2discord
  - Modrinth (Download): https://modrinth.com/mod/mc2discord
  - Discord (Support): https://discord.gg/rzzd76c
  - Github (Source code): https://github.com/DenisD3D/Mc2Discord
  - Wiki (Configuration guide): https://github.com/DenisD3D/Mc2Discord/wiki


 FOLLOW THE CONFIGURATION GUIDE IN THE WIKI: https://github.com/DenisD3D/Mc2Discord/wiki


 Support is available through the Discord server
config.general.token.comment: Token for the Discord bot account, equivalent to a password obtainable through the Discord website (see: https://github.com/DenisD3D/Mc2Discord/wiki/Discord-token)
config.channels.comment:
Channels configuration
 One [[Channels.Channel]] block should be created per Discord channel you want to setup
config.channels.id.comment: Id of the Discord channel to send messages in (see: https://github.com/DenisD3D/Mc2Discord/wiki/Discord-ids)
config.channels.subscriptions.comment: List of messages types to send that will be sent in this channel. Available values: "info", "chat", "command", "logs" ("info" is equivalent to adding "server_start", "server_stop", "player_connect", "player_disconnect", "player_death", "player_advancement")
config.channels.mode.comment: Messages format in this channel. Available values: WEBHOOK, PLAIN_TEXT, EMBED
config.messages.comment:
Messages content configuration
 Variables (${xxx}) are replaced by corresponding values (see complete list of variables: https://github.com/DenisD3D/Mc2Discord/wiki/Variables)
 "global" variables may be used in any field
config.messages.join.comment: When a player join the server ("player" variables are available)
config.messages.leave.comment: When a player join the server ("player" variables are available)
config.messages.death.comment: When a player die ("player" and "death" variables are available)
config.messages.advancement.comment: When a player unlock an advancement ("player" and "advancement" variables are available)
config.commands.prefix.comment: Prefix before each command. Minecraft default one is '/' (eg : /help)
config.commands.use_codeblocks.comment: If true, commands result are sent in a code block (```result```)
config.commands.permission.comment:
Commands permissions configuration.
 One [[Commands.Permission]] block should be created per Discord channel you want to setup
config.commands.permission.id.comment: Id of the Discord member or Discord role the permission apply to (0 <=> everyone)
config.commands.permission.permission_le: Minecraft permission level that will be allowed, all commands up to that level will be available (-1 <=> No commands, 0 <=> all non-op commands, 3 <=> all op commands)
config.commands.permission.commands.comm: List of commands that will be allowed in addition of the permission level
config.features.comment:
Enable additional features
 Executing "/mc2discord restart" is required to generate feature-related parts of the configuration file
config.features.status_channels.comment: Regular channels name and topic updates with global variables
config.features.account_linking.comment: Minecraft and Discord accounts linking with optional whitelist
config.status_channels.comment:
Status channels configuration
 One [[StatusChannels.Channel]] block should be created per Discord channel you want to setup
config.status_channels.id.comment: Id of the Discord channel of which to edit name and topic (see: https://github.com/DenisD3D/Mc2Discord/wiki/Discord-ids)
config.status_channels.name_message.comm: Value to set as name of the channel ("global" variables are available, whitespace are replaced by '-' in text channels)
config.status_channels.topic_message.com: Value set as description of the channel ("global" variables are available)
config.status_channels.update_period.com: Delay between to update of the channel (in seconds, any value below 610 may cause issues)
config.account.rename_discord_member.com: If true, Discord members will be renamed to discord_pseudo_format
config.account.discord_pseudo_format.com: Format to rename Discord members in ("player", "member" and "global" variables are available)
config.account.force_link.comment: If true, players will be asked to link their account before joining the server (whitelist)
config.account.messages.comment:
Content of messages related to account linking
 "global" variables may be used in any field
config.account.messages.link_get_code.co: When a player receive a link code ("${command}" and minecraft formatting variables are available)
config.account.messages.link_get_code.va: To link your account please send ${command} to ${bot_name}#${bot_discriminator} in a private message on Discord
When a player has successfully linked
You have successfully linked your account
config.account.messages.link_invalid_cod: When a player sent an invalid code
config.account.messages.link_error_alrea: When a player is already linked
config.account.messages.unlink_successfu: When a player has successfully unlinked
config.account.messages.missing_roles.co: When a player doesn't have required roles to link his account
config.account.messages.missing_roles.va: You don't have the required roles to link your account
config.account.policies.comment:
Account linking requirements configuration
 One [[Account.Policy]] block should be created per account linking requirements
config.account.policies.required_roles_i: List of Discord roles id that are required to link an account (a member must have all these roles to be able to link his account)
config.account.policies.roles_id_to_give: List of Discord roles id that will be given to a member when he link his account
config.style.bot_name.comment: Override the bot name in webhook and embed mode ("global" variables are available)
config.style.bot_avatar.comment: Override the bot avatar in webhook and embed mode, must be a valid URL to an image ("global" variables are available)
config.style.webhook_display_name.commen: Set the format of the player name appearing next to chat message when using webhook mode ("player" and "global" variables are available)
config.style.webhook_avatar_api.comment: URL used to get players head, must be a valid URL to an image ("player" and "global" variables are available)
config.style.minecraft_chat_format.comme: Format used for messages sent in minecraft chat. ("${reply}", "${attachements}", "member", "message", "global" and minecraft formatting variables are available)
config.style.reply_format.comment: Replace ${reply} in minecraft_chat_format if the message has a referenced message. ("member" (author of the referenced message) and "global" variables are available).
config.style.discord_chat_format.comment: Format used for chat messages in PLAIN_TEXT mode ("player", "message" and "global" variables are available)
config.style.embed_show_bot_avatar.comme: If true, bot avatar will be shown in the embed for info messages
config.style.embed_show_server_avatar.co: If true, bot avatar will be shown in the embed for info messages
config.style.embed_colors.comment: Embed colors. A color from https://github.com/DenisD3D/Mc2Discord/wiki/Embed-Colors or a decimal color
config.style.presence.message.comment: Message to display under the bot in the member list on Discord ("global" variables are available)
config.status.presence.type.comment: The type of presence (PLAYING, STREAMING, LISTENING, WATCHING, COMPETING or CUSTOM)
config.status.presence.update.comment: Delay between to update of the channel (in seconds, any value below 610 may cause issues)
config.status.presence.link.comment: Only if type is STREAMING, ignored for others type, must be a valid youtube or twitch link.
config.misc.relay_bot_messages.comment: If true, other bots messages will be sent in minecraft chat
config.misc.allowed_mention.comment: List of allowed mentions from minecraft (supported value: "EVERYONE_AND_HERE", "ROLE", "USER")
config.misc.logs_format.comment: Format for server logs on Discord
config.misc.logs_level.comment: Level for server logs on Discord (supported values: FATAL, ERROR, WARN, INFO, DEBUG, TRACE, ALL)
config.misc.broadcast_commands.comment: List of commands to broadcast to Discord. If absent message will only be sent to Minecraft (supported values: say, me, tellraw)
If true, any message sent by another mod will be logged to the console (used only for configuration of [[Misc.OtherModMessage]], must be disabled after)
config.misc.other_mods_messages.comment:
Configuration for messages from others mods
 Values may be found on the wiki (https://github.com/DenisD3D/Mc2Discord/wiki/Other-Mods-Messages) or by enabling verbose_other_mods_messages
config.misc.other_mods_messages.class_na: Name of the Java class the message is comming from
config.misc.other_mods_messages.class_in: Index of the class in the stacktrace
config.misc.other_mods_messages.type.com: Type the message will be sent as, must be one found in a Channels.Channel configuration
